channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Prosecutor Wins, McCarthy’s Successor Is Set and Other Election Takeaways
item.description: In Georgia, the prosecutor and judge in Donald Trump’s criminal case won their races easily, and a Trump-backed California legislator will finish former Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s term.

item.title: Under Relentless Russian Assault, Ukraine Adopts a Defensive Crouch
item.description: As Moscow’s forces retake land from which they were ousted at the end of 2022, the Ukrainian military has adopted a strategy of fighting while slowly falling back to more heavily fortified positions.

item.title: The skyrocketing cost of health care is creating ‘a new type of pandemic,’ health VC says
item.description: “When you can’t afford health care, you’re not buying your prescriptions, you’re delaying the delivery of care, you’re not making appointments… it’s a massive problem,” Lee Shapiro said.

item.title: Under Relentless Russian Assault, Ukraine Adopts a Defensive Crouch
item.description: As Moscow’s forces retake land from which they were ousted at the end of 2022, the Ukrainian military has adopted a strategy of fighting while slowly falling back to more heavily fortified positions.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Spain, Norway and Ireland Recognize a Palestinian State, a Blow to Israel
item.description: The European nations joined scores of others that recognize Palestinian statehood, which Israel has long opposed.

item.title: America’s productivity growth is recovering to pre-Great Financial Crisis rates. Europe has more work to do
item.description: By stepping up the pace of investment and technological innovation, it is possible to leave the era of stagnation behind.

item.title: Iowa Town Is Devastated by Deadly Storms and Tornado: What to Know
item.description: Severe weather destroyed much of Greenfield, where officials were continuing search and rescue work overnight to determine the death toll.

item.title: Ireland’s Palestinian State Recognition Nods to Its Own History
item.description: Simon Harris, Ireland’s prime minister, invoked his nation’s struggle for independence from Britain and its decades of violent sectarian conflict.

item.title: Biden administration is cancelling $7.7bn more in federal student loans for 160,000 borrowers
item.description: The latest relief will go to borrowers in three categories who hit certain milestones that make them eligible for cancellation.

item.title: Biden’s Open War on Hidden Fees
item.description: Targeting “junk fees” from the likes of airlines and credit-card companies has been a way for the president to show Americans that he’s acting to lower prices.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Leads Funeral Prayers for President
item.description: State news media in Iran reported that the political leader of Hamas was in the capital for the funeral. It was not immediately clear how many foreign dignitaries would attend.

item.title: Women get dismissed by doctors—and it’s led to devastating consequences for cancer, says the OB/GYN Olivia Munn credits with saving her life
item.description: “Our complaints are dismissed…every time we open our mouths,” she said.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Leads Funeral Prayers for President
item.description: State news media in Iran reported that the political leader of Hamas was in the capital for the funeral. It was not immediately clear how many foreign dignitaries would attend.

item.title: Kenyan President’s State Visit: An Antidote to U.S. Troubles in Africa?
item.description: The White House is hosting President William Ruto of Kenya for a state dinner this week, an embrace that both countries urgently need.

item.title: The Welsh island of Anglesey set to house the U.K.’s next large nuclear power station
item.description: So far there's only large-scale plant under construction in the country, with another still working to get financing.
